definitions: a painter, writer, or composer who is an exponent of expressionism, seeking to express through their work the inner world of emotion rather than external reality

examples.text: the American abstract expressionist, Jackson Pollock

notes.text: Expressionists characteristically reject traditional ideas of beauty or harmony and use distortion, exaggeration, and other non-naturalistic devices in order to express emotional states. The paintings of El Greco and Grünewald exemplify expressionism in this broad sense, but the term is also used of a late 19th and 20th century European and specifically German movement tracing its origins to Van Gogh, Edvard Munch, and James Ensor, which insisted on the primacy of the artist's feelings and mood, often incorporating violence and the grotesque

definitions: relating to expressionism or its exponents

examples.text: he placed emphasis on an expressionist style
an exhibition of abstract expressionist paintings

notes.text: Expressionists characteristically reject traditional ideas of beauty or harmony and use distortion, exaggeration, and other non-naturalistic devices in order to express emotional states. shortDefinitions: relating to expressionism or its exponents
